New Records: Jean-Philippe Krasso scored his third goal in the 2025 Afcon qualifiers, converting two goals in the match against Chad.
Oumar Diakite scored his first international goal for Ivory Coast, marking a significant milestone in the match.
Key Match Events: Jean-Philippe Krasso scored twice, with a third-minute goal after halftime to give Ivory Coast a 1-0 lead.
Oumar Diakite's goal in the 55th minute effectively secured the match for Ivory Coast.
Chad's goalkeeper Gabin Allabatna had a strong performance but couldn't prevent the two goals.
Pre-Game Insights: Ivory Coast dominated possession and created several chances in the first half, indicating their superior preparation and strategy.
Post-Match Reflections: Ivory Coast's victory gave them six points in Group G, solidifying their position in the qualifiers.
The match highlighted Ivory Coast's depth and ability to adapt to defensive challenges.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The halftime scoreline was 1-0 in favor of Ivory Coast, setting the tone for the second half.
Both teams made strategic substitutions, with Ivory Coast maintaining their pressure and Chad focusing on counterattacks.
Others: The match was played at the Ahmadou Ahidjo Stadium in Yaounde, Cameroon, with a capacity crowd supporting Ivory Coast.
